conversations.value: How do I put out a kitchen fire?

Kitchen fires can be put out in many different ways.  They can be extinguished using several different kinds of fire extinguishers, in addition to pouring water or putting out a fire with baking soda.  If it’s in a trash can or elsewhere it’s hard to find, your best bet is to make sure you or others around you have a fire extinguisher.  You can put out a fire with a fire extinguisher by aiming the spray at the fire.
How do I put out an oven fire specifically?

Oven fires are notoriously tricky to extinguish.  There are many possible methods for putting out an oven fire.  You can get baking soda, which can be used to create a chemical reaction and cool down the fire.  You can also try to put the fire out with other extinguishers, like a CO2 extinguisher.
Can I use water?

Water can be used to extinguish oven fires, but it is not the best option in general.  As the oven gets hotter, more and more water will boil off and not affect the fire in any way.  So this is a limited method, and it’s best to use other methods when possible.
